element.name: Phoenix Park - Castleknock Gate by Lahtac, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)
element.description:
Dublin’s Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city.
At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed recreational spaces within any European capital city.

long-description.p: Few cities have such a facility on their doorsteps – it is more than twice as large as Central Park in New York.
The park was for centuries the property of the King’s representatives in Ireland, used as a Royal hunting park – which is why it was enclosed by a wall, to keep the game in.
However it was opened to the public in 1747 and so for more than 250 years has been a favourite playground for generations of Dubliners.

The Park is also home to the Zoological Gardens and Aras an Uachtarain and Victorian flower gardens. The Phoenix Park is only 1.5 miles from O'Connell Street. Both passive and active recreational pursuits may be viewed or pursued such as walking, running, polo, cricket, hurling, etc. The Glen Pond is set in very scenic surrounds in the Furry Glen. There are many walks and cycle routes available to the public.
The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and visitors can explore freely.
Bus Route(s): No's 10, 37, 38, 39, 66, 67 from city centre.
The cache is located on a trek adjacent to the gate keeper’s lodge.
Parking is freely available at N53.22.166 W06.20.885

ul.li:
2010-06-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by nisse_perlemo
Found after some searching among creepy crawlies and nettles. Well hidden. TFTC!

2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by poohbear50
See GC284RJ Phoenix Park Ashdown lodge for our comments for this series. TFTC Log full

2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by Wild Rover
See GC248RJ Phoenix Park Ashdown lodge for our comments and story for this Phoenix Park series. TFTC

2010-06-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by rooske
handy find on a lovley walk in the park

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by garrethmolloy
Must have missed it, see someone else found it same day so may have been absent for a little while, will try again.

Dublin’s Phoenix Park is a treasure with more than 1700 acres of walled parkland just 3km from the centre of the city.

At 707 hectares (1752 acres) is one of the largest enclosed recreational spaces within any European capital city.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:

The Park is also home to the Zoological Gardens and Aras an Uachtarain and Victorian flower gardens. The Phoenix Park is only 1.5 miles from O'Connell Street. There are many walks and cycle routes available to the public.

The park is open all year round, there is no admission charge and visitors can explore freely.
